fields.title: Kisumu-Malaba SGR Resettlement Action Plan
fields.short_description: Comprehensive survey and mapping for the Kisumu-Malaba Standard Gauge Railway resettlement action plan covering affected communities.
fields.detailed_description: Extensive land surveying project for the proposed Standard Gauge Railway Phase 2C from Kisumu to Malaba. The project involved corridor mapping, affected parcel identification, and comprehensive surveying to support the resettlement action plan for displaced communities.
fields.location: Kisumu, Vihiga, Siaya, Kakamega and Busia Counties
fields.challenge: The railway corridor passes through densely populated areas with complex land ownership patterns. Accurate mapping of affected parcels and infrastructure was critical for fair compensation and successful resettlement of affected communities.
fields.solution: Implemented systematic surveying approach with control densification, precise corridor pegging, and detailed mapping of all affected parcels. Used GPS and total station surveys to ensure accuracy and legal compliance for compensation processes.
fields.results: Successfully mapped over 5,000 affected parcels, established comprehensive compensation database, and provided critical data for resettlement planning. The surveys support infrastructure development worth over KES 200 billion.
success_metrics: All affected parcels identified and surveyed

fields.title: Kenya Power Transmission Assets Transfer Survey
fields.short_description: Comprehensive land and asset verification survey for the transfer of transmission line assets from Kenya Power to KETRACO.
fields.detailed_description: Large-scale asset verification project involving comprehensive survey due diligence, boundary assessment, and location confirmation for transmission line assets being transferred from Kenya Power to Kenya Electricity Transmission Company (KETRACO).
fields.challenge: The project required verification of hundreds of transmission line assets across the country, with varying land tenure systems and complex ownership patterns. Accurate boundary verification and asset location confirmation was critical for the legal transfer process.
fields.solution: Deployed teams nationwide to conduct systematic boundary verification surveys, asset mapping, and land tenure analysis. Used GPS technology and ground truthing to verify asset locations and assess boundary status for each parcel.
fields.results: Successfully verified and mapped over 800 transmission line assets, completed boundary assessments for associated land parcels, and provided comprehensive documentation supporting the legal asset transfer process.
success_metrics: Successful facilitation of asset transfer process

fields.title: National e-Waste Inventory Development
fields.short_description: Country-wide situation analysis and development of a comprehensive national e-waste inventory using GIS technology.
fields.detailed_description: Comprehensive environmental project involving country-wide analysis of electronic waste management and development of a national inventory system. The project combined field data collection, GIS mapping, and database development to create a comprehensive e-waste management tool.
fields.challenge: Kenya lacked a comprehensive understanding of e-waste generation, management practices, and disposal sites. Creating a national inventory required extensive field work, stakeholder engagement, and development of sustainable data collection systems.
fields.solution: Conducted systematic country-wide surveys, developed GIS-based inventory tools, and created standardized data collection protocols. Engaged with stakeholders across the e-waste value chain to build comprehensive database of e-waste flows and management practices.
fields.results: Delivered comprehensive national e-waste inventory, identified key waste streams and management gaps, and provided policy recommendations for sustainable e-waste management. The inventory now serves as a baseline for national e-waste policy development.

fields.title: Muringato Catchment Environmental Conservation
fields.client_name: German Federal Ministry of Education and Research
fields.short_description: Development of GIS-based participatory tools and hydrological modeling for environmental conservation of the Muringato catchment area.
fields.detailed_description: International research collaboration focused on environmental conservation in the Muringato catchment. The project involved development of participatory GIS tools, hydrological modeling, and stakeholder engagement to support sustainable catchment management practices.
fields.challenge: The Muringato catchment faced environmental degradation due to unsustainable land use practices. There was need for scientific tools to support community-based conservation efforts and evidence-based decision making for catchment management.
fields.solution: Developed innovative participatory GIS tools for data crowdsourcing, conducted detailed hydrological modeling, and engaged local stakeholders in conservation planning. Combined scientific research with community participation to create sustainable conservation strategies.
fields.results: Successfully developed and deployed participatory conservation tools, established baseline environmental data, and created sustainable framework for community-based catchment management. Research findings published in international journals.

fields.title: Land Administration Domain Model Implementation
fields.client_organization: United States Agency for International Development
fields.short_description: Pilot implementation of the internationally recognized Land Administration Domain Model (LADM) for Kenya's land management systems.
fields.detailed_description: Pioneering project to adapt and implement the ISO-standard Land Administration Domain Model for Kenya. The project involved customizing LADM to local contexts, developing prototype systems, and demonstrating improved land administration through international best practices.
fields.challenge: Kenya's land administration systems lacked standardization and interoperability. There was need to align national land information systems with international standards while addressing local land tenure complexities.
fields.solution: Adapted the international LADM standard to Kenya's specific land tenure systems, developed prototype land information system, and demonstrated benefits of standardized land administration. Engaged stakeholders to ensure local relevance and sustainability.
fields.results: Successfully demonstrated LADM implementation in Kenya, influenced national land information system design, and established foundation for standardized land administration. Project outcomes informed national land policy development.

fields.title: Training and Land Policy Development for Tana Water
fields.short_description: Training and formulation of comprehensive Land and Wayleaves Policy for Tana Water Works Development Agency.
fields.detailed_description: Specialized consulting project focused on capacity building and policy development for Tana Water Works Development Agency. The project involved training staff on land policy formulation and developing a comprehensive Land and Wayleaves Policy to guide the agency's land acquisition and management processes.
fields.challenge: Tana Water Works Development Agency lacked comprehensive policies for land acquisition and wayleaves management. Staff needed capacity building in land policy formulation to support the agency's infrastructure development mandate.
fields.solution: Designed and delivered comprehensive training program on land policy formulation and best practices. Developed tailored Land and Wayleaves Policy addressing the agency's specific needs for water infrastructure development and land management.
fields.results: Successfully trained agency staff on land policy development, delivered comprehensive Land and Wayleaves Policy, and established framework for systematic land acquisition and management supporting water infrastructure projects.
